DataElement.preferredName: MBSImP Component 17 Esophageal Clearance Upright Position Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score for the assessment of esophageal clearance in the upright position in the esophageal impairment section of the Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile Esophageal Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Esophageal Clearance Following Swallowing in Upright Position
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function._An assessment of an individual's esophageal impairment during swallowing._An observation of an individual's esophageal clearance after swallowing in an upright position.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Concepts.definition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Property.preferredName: Esophageal Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Esophageal Clearance Following Swallowing in Upright Position
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of an individual's esophageal impairment during swallowing.:An observation of an individual's esophageal clearance after swallowing in an upright position.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of an individual's esophageal impairment during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Impairment of Esophageal Clearance Following Swallowing in Upright Position
Concepts.definition: An observation of an individual's esophageal clearance after swallowing in an upright position.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: MBSImP:Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile, Martin-Harris et al., 2008
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave as requested by D.Lawrence. mc 6/8/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of minimal to no esophageal clearance.

Concepts.longName: Minimal to No Esophageal Clearance Following Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of minimal to no esophageal clearance.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophageal retention with retrograde flow through PES

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophageal retention with retrograde flow through PES
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of esophageal retention with retrograde flow through the pharyngoesophageal segment.

Concepts.longName: Esophageal Retention with Retrograde Flow Through Pharyngoesophageal Segment Following Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of esophageal retention with retrograde flow through the pharyngoesophageal segment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Esophageal retention with retrograde flow below pharyngoesophageal segment (PES)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Esophageal retention with retrograde flow below pharyngoesophageal segment (PES)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of esophageal retention with retrograde flow below the pharyngoesophageal segment.

Concepts.longName: Esophageal Retention with Retrograde Flow Below Pharyngoesophageal Segment Following Swallowing
Concepts.definition: A finding of esophageal retention with retrograde flow below the pharyngoesophageal segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of esophageal retention following swallowing.

Concepts.definition: A finding of esophageal retention following swallowing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of complete esophageal clearance following swallowing.

Concepts.definition: A finding of complete esophageal clearance following swallowing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave as requested by D.Lawrence. mc 6/8/16
